abstract: Citigroup won regulatory approval to open two lending companies to provide loans to rural residents in Hubei Province in central China.
snippet: Citigroup won regulatory approval to open two lending companies to provide loans to rural residents in Hubei Province in central China.
lead_paragraph: Citigroup won regulatory approval to open two lending companies to provide loans to rural residents in Hubei Province in central China. The provincial branch of the China Banking Regulatory Commission approved the Citibank (China) Company’s formation of the Hubei Jingzhou Gong’an Citi Lending Company and the Hubei Xian’ning Chibi Citi Lending Company. The two companies, which will offer secured and unsecured loans without taking deposits, will start operations “within months,” the bank said. HSBC and Standard Charter also are opening rural branches in China.
